stream_context.summary: Kaze livestreams while eating and preparing to leave for a wedding. The main on-stream task is programming and play-testing the new "oil block" boss: fixing framerate regressions, tuning movement, camera, and animation, and debating difficulty and penalties for falling into oil. Secondary topics include file-size limits for music, a potential perk system to address accessibility vs. challenge, and general reflections on ROM-hack design constraints.
level: Oil-block boss arena (world/level name not yet final)

development_findings.summary: Silas’s new optimization dropped the game to 30 FPS; Kaze reverted to the old code and will report back to Silas.
development_findings.quote: He definitely is 30 FPS again… This is actually Silas's code… I'll let Celes know.

development_findings.summary: Actively scripting the oil-block boss: movement toward Mario, faster rotation, attack startup, sine-wave dive animation, camera lock, eye visibility, and platform height were iteratively tuned live.
development_findings.quote: I think this is pretty playable… Maybe I should make the block a little smaller so you can see his eyes better.

development_findings.summary: Considering the penalty for falling into the oil pool: leaning toward water-type damage-over-time instead of instant death to avoid frustration.
development_findings.quote: I don't want to make it too frustrating… Water with damage over time is perfect.

development_findings.summary: Discussion of camera design: camera should tilt lower when the boss is distant and higher when close, so players can track both boss and platforms.
development_findings.quote: Why does the camera point further down when the block is closer? Because it's pointing below him… Let's make the camera point further up the closer he gets.

development_findings.summary: Fast inverse-square-root algorithm critique; Kaze feels the classic Quake trick is over-rated and constants are under-tuned, hinting at future performance work.
development_findings.quote: Oh yeah guys, I also recently became a hater of the inverse square root algorithm… They have 3 constants and they only optimized one.

development_findings.summary: Size limits: an unused dojo track is 5 MB as WAV; will likely need MIDI conversion or be cut because ROM space is tight.
development_findings.quote: That song is huge—it's gonna take up like 5 megabytes of ROM space and we don't really have that space.

development_findings.summary: Kaze proposes a single-perk system (e.g., ‘no voidouts’, ‘faster speed’) unlocked in the overworld to balance difficulty without full RPG-style badges.
development_findings.quote: If anything, it's gonna be a single perk… I don't want you to build a custom character.

development_findings.summary: Recognizes ROM-hack audiences expect easy 100 % completion, which limits secret design; starts a YouTube poll to gauge expectations.
development_findings.quote: There's a problem with playing ROM hacks… the player's expectation is that they can easily 100 % the game.

development_findings.summary: Animation export bug surfaced (translation not applied); Kaze debugged Fast64 export and fixed operator-precedence error in code.

context_findings.summary: Kaze had to shorten the stream for a friend’s wedding; expresses dislike of weddings and jokes about bringing a DS.
context_findings.quote: It's gonna be awful… I wish I could just bring my DS like a little child.

context_findings.summary: He and Zeina made a sewn plush as a wedding gift; Kaze’s hands hurt from sewing, showing personal investment beyond coding.
context_findings.quote: I worked very hard on this all week. My hands were in pain… Isn't he gorgeous?

context_findings.summary: Personal philosophy: player emotions are real and must be respected, but their stated reasoning can be ignored when designing.
context_findings.quote: What people feel, in a way, is real… but their reasoning is most of the time stupid.

context_findings.summary: Self-assessment of growth: feels he’s ‘evolving’—getting better at programming, gaming, and lifting weights.
context_findings.quote: Recently I feel like I have been evolving. I'm just getting so much better at everything.

context_findings.summary: Future planning: wants a house before having kids; confirms Zeina is not pregnant.
context_findings.quote: We need a house first. Having kids without a house is just stupid.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with Pokémon Scarlet/Violet quality and broader Pokémon franchise direction.
context_findings.quote: Dude, how are you the Pokémon company and you make fucking Scarlet and Violet?

biobak.summary: Suggested giving the oil-block boss metal teeth and thought light sources could improve visual clarity.
biobak.quote: Buy metal teeth. I think it looks very cool.

biobak.summary: Provided ongoing visual feedback: platform height, camera angles, vertex displacement.
Finished a ‘cart’ asset (context: wedding cart prop) and will clean the car before the wedding.
biobak.quote: All right. I just gotta go clean up the car.

badub.summary: Discussed an unused dojo song; noted its large file size (5 MB WAV) and suggested it could initiate the final challenge.
badub.quote: We have a problem though—that song is huge… But I like that idea for how the final challenge should start.

zeina.summary: Offered to animate but focused on finishing the ‘wedding cart’; only partially on stream due to wedding prep.
zeina.quote: So while I have a minute, do you have any animations you want me to do real quick?… The wedding cart—Not yet.

zeina.summary: Sewed a plush wedding present; playful on-stream banter, teases Kaze about smelling like chicken and rice, shows supportive but joking dynamic.
zeina.quote: You smell like chicken and rice.

zeina.summary: Will handle car cleanup and logistics for wedding; calls Kaze ‘bitch’ jokingly, highlighting informal rapport.
zeina.quote: What you call me that live on stream?… I can't believe she's trying to embarrass me live on stream.

key_stories.title: Framerate Regression & Revert
key_stories.summary: Silas supplied an optimized routine meant to raise FPS, but the game dropped to 30 FPS and animations broke. Kaze investigated live, confirmed the regression, reverted to the previous commit, and plans to inform Silas.
key_stories.challenge: Sudden 30 FPS cap after integrating Silas’s performance code.
key_stories.process: Verified issue, compared with older GitHub version, rebuilt, and restored prior code.
key_stories.outcome: Performance returned to normal; Kaze will report findings to Silas.
key_stories.key_quote: He definitely is 30 FPS again… This is actually Silas's code. I'll let Celes know.

key_stories.title: Design Space vs. 100 % Expectation
key_stories.summary: Kaze realizes ROM-hack players assume they must 100 % complete everything, limiting his ability to hide secrets and add hard optional content. He polls viewers to measure expectations and brainstorms a perk system to reconcile difficulty.
key_stories.challenge: Audience demands easy full completion reduce creative freedom for secrets and challenges.
key_stories.process: Explained dilemma on stream, created YouTube poll, debated badge vs. single-perk solutions with chat.
key_stories.outcome: Leaning toward overworld-found single perks; awaiting poll results for guidance.
key_stories.key_quote: There's a problem with playing ROM hacks… the player's expectation is that they can easily 100 % the game.

key_stories.title: Oil-Block Boss Iteration
key_stories.summary: Live coding session iteratively refines a new boss: tuning movement speed, attack startup, camera behavior, and dive animation, with feedback from Biobak and chat.
key_stories.challenge: Boss felt too hard to track and dodge; camera obscured platforms and eyes.
key_stories.process: Adjusted rotation speed, lowered boss position, scaled model, added camera lock logic, and tested penalties for oil fall.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze declares fight ‘pretty playable’ but notes further polish needed.
key_stories.key_quote: I think this is pretty playable… What do you guys think?

key_stories.title: Hand-sewn Wedding Gift
key_stories.summary: Zeina spent the week sewing a plush for friends’ wedding; Kaze showcases it proudly though time-pressed.
key_stories.challenge: Learning to use a sewing machine and completing plush in time.
key_stories.process: Zeina sewed despite hand pain; Kaze shows plush on camera.
key_stories.outcome: Gift finished; couple leaves early for wedding.
key_stories.key_quote: I finally learned how to use a sewing machine too—I almost don't want to give him away.
